content:
Why do I see these empty boats, sailing on airy seas? 
One haunted me the whole night long, swaying with every breeze, 
Returning always near the eaves, or by the skylight glass: 
There it will wait me many weeks, and then, at last, will pass. 
Each soul is haunted by a ship in which that soul might ride 
And climb the glorious mysteries of Heaven's silent tide 
In voyages that change the very metes and bounds of Fate â€” 
O empty boats, we all refuse, that by our windows wait!
cleaned: why do i see these empty boats sailing airy seas one haunted me the whole night long swaying with every breeze returning always the eaves or the skylight glass there it will wait me many weeks and then last will pass each soul haunted a ship which that soul might ride and climb the glorious mysteries heaven s silent tide voyages that change the very metes and bounds fate o empty boats we all refuse that our windows wait
